intro: Racosperma leiocalyx, commonly known as the slender-flowered acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in spikes. It is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various native animals.
